security_audit.summary: Legitimate SecOps toolkit with template scripts. Scripts are skeleton code with placeholder implementations. Filesystem access is limited to user-specified target paths. No network operations, credential access, or malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Automate security scanning and vulnerability assessment
content.value_statement: Security operations require consistent assessment and compliance validation across projects. This skill provides automated tools for security scanning, vulnerability assessment, and compliance checking with standardized reporting.
actual_capabilities: Run automated security scans on project codebases
Assess vulnerabilities with configurable target paths
Enable verbose output for detailed debugging
limitations: Scripts are template-based with placeholder analysis logic
Does not integrate with external vulnerability databases
Requires Python 3 to execute scripts locally

use_cases.title: Automated security scans
use_cases.description: Run consistent security scans across multiple codebases with standardized tooling.

use_cases.title: CI/CD security gates
use_cases.description: Integrate security checks into deployment pipelines with automated reporting.

use_cases.title: Compliance verification
use_cases.description: Verify projects meet security standards and generate audit documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security scan on my project at [project-path] and report any findings.

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a vulnerability assessment on [target-path] with verbose output. Check for common security issues like injection vulnerabilities, authentication weaknesses, and insecure configurations.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my project at [project-path] for compliance with security standards. Generate a detailed report of any compliance gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Full security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a complete security audit of [target-path] using all three secops tools. Run security scanner, vulnerability assessor, and compliance checker. Generate a combined JSON report with all findings prioritized by severity.

output_examples.input: Run a security scan on my project at ./src

best_practices: Always validate target paths before running scans to prevent accidental analysis of wrong directories.
Use JSON output format for integration with other tools and automated workflows.
Combine multiple secops tools for comprehensive security coverage across your codebase.
anti_patterns: Running security scans without understanding what the tool actually analyzes.
Ignoring findings because the scripts contain placeholder logic.
Assuming automated tools replace manual security review and penetration testing.

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill provides general security scanning. Actual language support depends on implementing analysis logic in the scripts.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with vulnerability databases?
faq.answer: No, the current implementation is a template. Integration with databases would require custom implementation.

faq.question: Can I run these scripts in CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --json flag to output machine-readable results suitable for pipeline integration.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No, all analysis runs locally. Scripts do not make network requests or transmit data externally.

faq.question: What should I do when findings are reported?
faq.answer: Review findings, validate them manually, prioritize by severity, and implement appropriate remediation steps.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial security tools?
faq.answer: This provides a framework for security automation. Commercial tools offer deeper analysis, larger vulnerability databases, and additional features.
